content: - b - b - b - b - b - b - b - - b - b row 7-10 - b - rt - b - b - b - b - b - b - b - b - b - b - lt - b - b row 6 - b - - b - b - b - b - b - b - b - b - b - b - - b - b row 1-5 30 20 10 1 cid 1  2 p o l l y j e a n leg work the main chart around 4 1/2 times ending with row 6 this should measure approximately 5 5 inches if you prefer your sock shorter or taller you can decrease or increase the number of repeats until you reach the desired length just make sure you re stopping at either row 6 or 12 of the chart and make sure to remember where you are cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 main - b - - b - - b - l ^ r - b - - b - b - b - - b - o o - b - / \ - b - - b - b - b - - b - - b - - b - - b - b - b - - b - o o - b - / \ - b - - b - b - b - - b - - b - - b - - b - b - b - rt - b - o o - b - / \ - b - lt - b - b - b - - b - l ^ r - b - - b - - b - b - b - - b - / \ - b - o o - b - - b - b - b - - b - - b - - b - - b - b - b - - b - / \ - b - o o - b - - b - b - b - - b - - b - - b - - b - b - b - rt - b - / \ - b - o o - b - lt - b - b 30 20 10 1 heel flap heel flap is worked over 33 stitches total counting from the beginning of the row you ll need to transfer the first stitch from the instep to the heel flap work the heel flap chart for 32 row total ending with row 2 of the chart keep in mind when you re facing the right side you must slip the first and last stitch purlwise to create a nice chain to be picked up later for the gusset and other slipped stitches must be slipped knitwise to continue the twisted stitch motif cid
